A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif de s’adonner à l’élevage des petits ruminants dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous families, the six women of the group Benkadi average 43 years of age and six children each. The women all live in the village of Massala, the seat of the Rural Commune, in the Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through the village fair. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments (tomatoes, onions, …), tubers, and grain. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members found out how to join [the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso] and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Ramatou (second woman from the right in the photo) is a major seller of grain in the  village. She intends to use her loan to buy 4 sacks of millet. She resupplies herself with rice at the big market of Ségou from wholesalers from Niono. Cash or credit, the retail sales are made at the fair and out of her house to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With the loan, Ms. Ramatou plans to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting household needs in terms of basic necessities. Just like the other women of the group, she has the goal of devoting her time to raising small ruminants in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Victor is 29 years old and runs a multi-service internet shop with his brother while attending classes at the school of fine arts. The shop offers internet, photocopying, and printing services, and Victor has been working there for about a year. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase an additional computer, as his shop currently has only five computer stations. 

In the future, Victor would like to invest in gaming machines such as a PlayStation so that his business can offer additional services. In the long run, Victor is dedicated to mastering his studies of sculpture and painting so that he can start a business producing and selling ceramics.

Victor is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for his internet shop.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 59 years old and married with eight children. She has been growing and selling seaweed for 12 years. Herminia earns about 5,900 PHP per month doing this farming. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school. She requested a loan to purchase seaweed, straw and wooden pegs. She hopes to achieve her goal of having all her children finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed, straw and wooden pegs

loans.name: Livia

texts.en:
Livia makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables from Cusco in the jungle town of Puerto Maldonado. About three times a month, Livia makes the 9-10 hour bus trip from the Andean mountains down into the rainforest. She brings grapes, apples, pears, oranges, and other fruit which can only grow in non-tropical climates. Livia has been engaged in this business for about eleven years. She is 34 years old and has an 11-month-old son, as well as an 11 and a 14 year old.

Livia is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell in Puerto Maldonado. In addition she occasionally sells chickens, rabbits, and vegetables. Her dream is to save enough money to build a house and to see all her children become professionals.

Livia is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as grapes, apples, pears, and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos menores. Tiene casa propia en la que vive con su familia en el sector Monteverde, en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope. Su comunidad cuenta aproximadamente con 150 familias.
La actividad a la que se dedica María es a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio y a la crianza de animales, los cuales una vez alcanzado su peso y talla ideal, los vende en el mercado local. Las dos actividades mencionadas las realiza en su domicilio, con 3 años de experiencia en el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de labores en agricultura.
El monto del préstamo solicitado asciende a 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán destinados para la compra de abarrotes y la adquisición de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
María is a 40 year old woman who is married with two minor children. She and her family live in their own home in the Monteverde sector in a rural area of the district of Móorope. Her community is made up of approximately 150 families.

María sells groceries in her house and also raises animals which, once they have reached their optimum weight and size, she sells at the local market. She conducts these two businesses in her home, with three years of experience doing so. She makes additional income from work in agriculture.

The amount of the loan is S/. 1,500, which will be used to purchase groceries and  nutritional feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, etc) and also nutritional feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 62 years old and primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also hires laborers to help till her land and harvest rice. Lourdes also runs a small sari-sari store business at her house. She sells bread, soft drinks and canned goods.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and plant vitamins. Lourdes hopes to be successful in her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and plant vitamins

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a sari-sari store owner from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 49 years old and married with three school-aged children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Remedios sells items like biscuits, shampoo and soap, canned goods and gasoline to her community. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month from her business. She does her best to be a good wife and mother to her family. She also prioritizes her children's education.

Remedios is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and gasoline. This will help increase Remedios' business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and gasoline

loans.name: Djèkafo Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe Djèkafo sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Massala chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des spaghettis, condiments (tomate, oignon, …), grains (arachide et riz) et pagnes cousus à la main. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce pour certaines et d’entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenus pour d’autres, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est la vendeuse de céréales dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz avec les forains de Niono au grand marché de Ségou en gros. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Sali espère trouver un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Djèkafo are married women for the most part from polygamous families. The women average 40 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of Massala, the seat of the Rural Commune, in the Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and marriage. They buy and sell spaghetti, condiments (tomatoes, onions, …), grain (peanuts and rice), and <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful West African cloth) sewn by hand.

With the goal of increasing their business capital for some of them and starting revenue-generating businesses for others, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Sali (the woman seated in the middle in the photo) is the seller of grain in the village. She intends to use her loan to buy 2 sacks of rice wholesale from the fair vendors from Niono at the big market of Ségou. Cash or credit, the retail sales are made out of her home and at the village fair to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Sali hopes to end up with an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting household needs in terms of condiments.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 64 años de edad, casada y sin hijos dependientes de ella. Tiene domicilio propio en el distrito de Mórrope, departamento de Lambayeque.  Es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa.
La actividad a la que se dedica María es la venta de abarrotes en una bodega tienda que funciona en su domicilio en la cual vende variedad de productos al contado y al crédito. María atiende todos los días y de corrido. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado menor. El esposo de María se dedica a la agricultura contribuyendo con el crecimiento del hogar.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 1200 nuevos soles los cuales los utilizará para adquirir más productos de primera necesidad con los que pueda surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
María is a 64 year old woman who is married and no longer has dependent children. She has her own home in the district of Mórrope, in Lambayeque Department. She is a very diligent and hardworking woman.

María has a store selling groceries in her home where she sells a variety of products, both for cash and on credit. She works every day non-stop. In addition, she also raises and sells small livestock. Her husband is a farmer and contributes to the expansion of the house 

The amount of the loan is S/. 1,200. She will use the money to acquire more staples to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 29 years old and raising three children between the ages of 1.5 and 10 with her partner. For three years, she has dedicated herself to selling teas, typically starting her workday at 9 a.m. and ending at 9 p.m. She offers all varieties, including herbal, corn and anise flavors. 

Juana is requesting a loan in order to continue making improvements on her house. She used her past loan to buy construction materials. Now she needs to purchase doors. Juana’s dream is to see her children become professionals. In addition, she would like to improve her business by upgrading to a stand where she can sell her teas.

Juana is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to buy doors for her house.

loans.name: Carlos Vidal

texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old and has three children with his partner. His kids are 5, 7 and 8 years old. While his partner runs a grocery store in Urcos, Carlos dedicates himself to driving a moto-taxi (a three-wheeled vehicle). Depending on how well his business is going, Carlos may drive exclusively in Urcos or go to his hometown in Madre de Dios province, about nine hours away, to earn more money. Sometimes he is away for one or two months. Carlos is requesting a loan in order to do annual general maintenance on his moto-taxi. In the future, he hopes to help his partner expand her grocery business.

Carlos is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to pay for annual maintenance on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 53 years old and has nine children who are now living independently. In the morning from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m., she sells food in the market. For example, she offers hot soups and grilled meats. In the afternoon, she runs a bar selling soft drinks, beer and chicha (a local corn-based drink). Juana also sells chickens and guinea pigs on the side. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase beer, soft drinks and cooking ingredients for the bar. Juana’s dream is to save money to improve her house and to visit her children who are living far away.

Juana is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soft drinks and cooking ingredients for her bar.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 26 años de edad es madre de 2 niños de 1 y 7 años de edad. Con sus ingresos de su miscelánea, genera el sustento de su hogar y esto es justamente su principal desafío. Ella inició su negocio hace 8 años porque al  no encontrar un empleo formal, debió ingeniárselas para producir desde su propio negocio;  mediante este negocio comercializa ropa de segunda, productos de bisutería y mercancía variada que promociona y vende directamente y mediante guías especializadas o catálogos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa de segunda y productos de bisutería, además de productos de belleza que vinieron en sus catálogos. Su credikiva aumentaría su capital de trabajo y le permitiría trabajar más holgadamente en términos de sus compras para responder a su clientela y aquí radica justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Diana, 26, is a mother of two children - ages 1 and 7. With her income from her store she makes enough to support her home, which is her biggest challenge. She started her business 8 years ago because she couldn't find a job, so she had to make do by creating her own. Through this business she sells secondhand clothing, jewelry and other various merchandise that she promotes and sells through guides and catalogs. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy used clothing, jewelry and beauty products from the catalogs. Her loan will increase her business capital and allow her to work more comfortably in terms of her purchases, so that she can respond to her customer's demands and make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, jewelry and beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Magally

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera y vive con sus padres en el caserío Tranca Fanupes, en el distrito de Túcume.
La actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de animales de corral, y adicionalmente a eso trabaja realizando jornales en las parcelas agrícolas. En la venta de animales de corral ya tiene una experiencia de 2 años y sus clientes son fijos, puesto que son comerciantes de mercados. Recalca la clienta a esta actividad como muy rentable en su zona, debido a que se encuentran en una zona rural.
El monto del crédito solicitado asciende a 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para la compra de animales y de alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en:
María is a 21-year-old single woman and lives with her parents in the town of Tranca Fanupes in the district of Túcume.

The business she makes a living at is the sale of barnyard animals. In addition to this, she works as a day laborer in farming plots. She now has two years of experience in the business of selling barnyard animals and she has a stable clientele as they are market retailers. She emphasizes that the customers make the business very profitable in her area as she is in a rural region. 

The amount of the loan requested has risen to 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will use to purchase animals and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee works at a bar from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. each day. Her bar offers food, such as hot soups and traditional main courses, as well as typical refreshments like beer, soda, and chicha (a local corn-based drink). Haydee has had this business for about three years and is requesting a loan to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell. She is living with her partner and four children between 2 and 15 years old, and dreams of improving her house as well as buying land for her children. She would also like to provide for her children’s education so that they can become professionals.

Haydee is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks for her bar.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita dedicates herself to buying and selling chickens and guinea pigs. She purchases the animals from small rural communities and then brings them to Urcos to sell. She has been engaged in this business for about three years. Margarita is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and guinea pigs. She is 37 years old and raising five children aged 7 to 19 with her partner. Margarita says that all the work she does is for her children, and she would like to see them all become professionals.

Margarita is a new member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, and has three children. 

Dominador has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Dominador has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Dominador hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Cirilo has a shop that sells fish like trout, mackerel, and sardines. He has had this business for two years. He has requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy more fish to sell. Cirilo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cirilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Roberto provides truck and multipurpose cab services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline. Roberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Sally has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Bandina

texts.en: Bandina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. Bandina has a food and retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She is also raising and selling pigs. She has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Bandina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Bandina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Mayver

texts.en:
Mayver is married and has two children. He is 23 years old and lives in the Dimaluna in Ozamis City.

To earn a living, Mayver operates a transportation and vulcanizing service for local community members. He has been doing this for five years, and every month he earns PHP 2,500 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair his vehicle so that he can offer better service.

Mayver joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Mayver hopes to help his children finish their studies and to double the income from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. Grace has a construction shop that sells a variety of sizes of timber and lumber. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more timber and lumber to sell. Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy timber and lumber for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Maribel is buying and selling clothes, like blouses, shirts, and underwear. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy clothing to sell. Maribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 42-year-old married mother of four. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her rice production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 36 years old. She earns 3,000 a month. In 2007, Lorna joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets harvested, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées toutes dans des familles monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Massala chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des spaghettis, condiments (tomate, pâte, …), arachide, tubercules (manioc) et pagnes cousus avec la laine à la main. Dans le but d’effectuer leurs achats au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré SORO YIRIWASO et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (1ère femme en position debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 corbeilles de tomate à la foire de Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et à la foire du village à une clientèle composée de femmes majoritairement. Madame Maimouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments. A l’image des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’effectuer l’élevage des petits ruminants dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Tièssiri group, all married in monogamous families, average 41 years of age and 5 children each.  They all live in Massala, the main village in the rural commune of Massala, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali).  They know each other because they are relatives or have become such through marriage.  They buy and sell spaghetti, condiments (tomato, paste...), groundnuts, tubers (cassava), as well as "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), hand-sewn with wool threads.  In order to pay cash for their purchases, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on to their second solidarity loan.

Maimouna (standing, first from the left, in the photo) is an important fruit seller in the village.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 40 baskets of tomatoes at the Konodimini fair.  She resells her merchandise for cash or on credit, from her home and at the village fair, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

Maimouna hopes that this loan will bring average monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business and also used to buy the condiments that her family needs.  Like the other women of the group, Maimouna's goal is to raise small cattle, through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Taalaigul

texts.ru:
Таалайгул 23 года, замужем, имеет сына 4 лет и дочь 2 года. С 2002 года Таалайгул занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Таалайгул имеется  1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь и 6 овец,  ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет примерно 5,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Таалайгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Таалайгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Taalaigul is 23 years old, married and has a four year old son and a two year old daughter. Since 2000 Taalaigul has been in the animal husbandry business which she started with 15,000 som (KGS). Today Taalaigul's business has one milk cow, one horse and six sheep with a monthly profit from the sale of milk and dairy products of approximately 5,000 KGS.

With the goal to further develop her business Taalaigul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy additional heads of livestock. Taalaigul plans to invest the income form the loan in increasing of the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font  la vente de médicaments, le commerce de produits cosmétique, de jus et de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Après une longue trêve, les femmes du groupe Danaya viennent de recommencer avec leur dixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des produits pharmaceutiques, de l’arachide, des produits cosmétiques, du charbon et jus.                                                                          
La cliente SOUMBA, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 4 cartons de produits pharmaceutiques au niveau des pharmacies de Bamako qui servira de premiers soins pour ses patients au niveau de son centre de soins pour les malades.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité d’achat de produits pharmaceutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age and four children each.  They live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana.  They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties.  They sell medications, cosmetic products, juice and charcoal.

After a long break, the women of the Danaya group have requested another loan and are on to their tenth solidarity loan.  This new loan will be used to buy pharmaceutical products, groundnuts, cosmetic products, charcoal and juice.

Soumba is the first woman from the left in the sitting row.  She is planning to buy four boxes of pharmaceutical products from pharmacies in Bamako.  These pharmaceutical products will be used as first-aid supplies in her health center where she attends to her patients.

Soumba is expecting average monthly profits to reach 25,000 CFA francs, which will be used in part to take care of her family's needs, while the rest will be reinvested into purchasing pharmaceutical products.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Islomuddin

texts.ru: Исломуддин женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Последние 5 лет он занимается купле – продажей сотовых телефонов, сим-карт и аксессуаров для мобильных телефонов. Его место бизнеса находится на центральном рынке города, местность многолюдная и много приезжих.  Исломуддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки сотовых телефонов, сим-карт и аксессуаров. Исломуддин надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Islomuddin is married and a responsible father of three children. He is a very hardworking and purposeful man. His wife is a homemaker. During the last five years he has been buying and selling mobile phones, SIM cards and accessories for mobile phones. His business location is on the central market in town where it's crowded and there are a lot of tourists. Islomuddin wants to receive a loan to buy mobile phones, SIM cards and accessories. He is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and their accessories.

loans.name: Isabel America

texts.es:
La señora Isabel es una mujer que dedicándose a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes ha logrado sacar sola a sus hijos adelante, con el fin de que nunca les haga falta nada y tengan el ejemplo de una mujer luchadora, que con esfuerzo pueden progresar constantemente.

Isabel ha pasado por muchos momentos difíciles, tales como los terremotos que han acontecido en los últimos meses, al igual que las constantes lluvias. Ella ha podido resguardar bien a sus hijos y lograr los ingresos que necesitaba para que cubra las necesidades diarias.

Actualmente Isabel se dedica  a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes, la cual está instalada en la sala de su casa, ella fue la que inicio este tipo de negocio en la zona en donde vive, ya que en ese momento aún no había ningún vecino suyo que se dedicase a la venta de los productos que ahora vende.

Isabel desea poder comprar cerveza, aceite, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, ente otros, ya que con estos productos sus clientes se sentirán contentos de que pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan en un mismo lugar. Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindando, ella se siente capaz de lograr el éxito y así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para que en algunos años sus hijos se conviertan en unos grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman who dedicates her life to selling groceries and beer. She has managed to get ahead in life with her children. Her goal is that they always have everything they need, that they have the example of a persevering woman and that with strength they can constantly progress.

Isabel has experienced many difficult moments, such as earthquakes and the constant rain, that have happened in the last few months. She has been able to protect her children and earn the income that she needed to cover the daily necessities.

Currently, Isabel sells beer and groceries in a store located in her living room. She started this type of business in the area where she lives since at the time, there was nobody selling the products that she now sells. 

Isabel wants to be able to buy beer, oil, sugar, rice, sodas, among other things. These products are what her customers are purchasing and they will be happy they can find everything they need in the same store. Thanks to the help she is receiving, she feels capable of succeeding and in this way she will improve the quality of life for her family so that her children may be able to work as professionals in a few years.

loans.use: purchase beer, oil, sugar, rice and soft drinks, among other products.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a qualified economist, aged 26. He runs his own money transfer business in Choma, a friendly town in the southern part of Zambia. He has been running his business for six months now.

Nicholas left his home town of Luanshya, a mining town located in the northern part of Zambia, to realize his dream of running his own business. He chose the business of mobile money transfers because he believes that mobile technology is one of the fastest growing industries in Africa. He finds joy in running a business that is quick and dependable and makes a difference in the lives of people around him. His face brightens as he describes how his business has become so popular since he opened six months ago. 

To make his business more effective, Nicholas has employed one person to help him serve his customers faster. When he gets his Kiva loan, he would like to put electricity in his trading booth and purchase two computers to make his transactions even faster. The rest of the money will go towards increasing his working capital, as this will enable him to make more profits.

His hopes and dreams are to be a successful businessman and own a chain of mobile money transfer shops across Zambia.

loans.use: to connect electricity in his trading booth and purchase two computers to make his transactions even faster.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Livingstone is home to one of the world’s seven natural wonders, Victoria Falls. This magnificent place is where 30-year-old Allan runs his mobile money transfer business.

Allan started running his business in June 2009 whilst working in an internet café. When he first started, he only served 10 to 20 customers in a day, but this is no longer the case. Allan now boasts of being one of the most successful mobile money business owners in the country. His customers now range from 60 to a 100 in a day. It is because of this growth that in February 2010, he opened his second shop which is also doing well.

Allan believes he is successful in his business because of his commitment to offer the very best customer service. He is happy to be able to provide a service that makes people’s lives easier. 

Running a business comes with many challenges. Allan’s biggest challenge is that the trading booth he is currently at his second outlet is not his. It belongs to a bus service. The owner of the bus service was kind enough to let him use a part of his space for his mobile money transfers. The trouble he says is that, his customers are inconvenienced, as there is no protection against weather elements such as rain or sun. He needs the Kiva loan to be able to buy his own trading booth, which will have a shade and some seats so that his customers can sit as they do the transactions.

His appeal to the kiva lenders is that they keep helping small businesses such as his because it goes a long way.

Allan dreams of opening up more shops in his beloved home town as the demand for his services keeps increasing. He would like to see a mobile money transfer shop at every corner in Livingstone.

loans.use: to purchase a new trading booth for his second shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on his working capital so that he can serve more customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells generic & over-the-counter medicines in tablets, capsules & syrups. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of generic & over-the-counter drugs to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of generic & over-the-counter drugs to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Marietta has a shop that sells fish like sardines, trout & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 18,000 to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Marietta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Marietta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Yèrèdon Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les neuf femmes du groupe Yèrèdon ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Massala chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans la foire du village. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de Spaghettis, de jus locaux et d’arachide. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maimouna (1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pâtes alimentaires dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de spaghettis en gros au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, à la foire du village et dans les villages environnants à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Maimouna compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants. Elle a pour ambition de devenir grossiste dans son activité avec ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: Married into mostly monogamous families, the nine women who form the Yèrèdon group are, on average, 39 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Massala in the region of Ségou (4th largest region in Mali) and know each other from family and community links, as well as through their business activities in the neighborhood. The members work together to sell spaghetti, local juices and peanuts. In order to increase their commercial activity, the group have become members of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are asking for their second loan. Mrs. Maimouna (seen in the photo as woman sitting down all the way to the left) has a strong reputation for selling food pastas in the village and surrounding areas. She plans to use the loan to purchase 10 bags of spaghetti from a bulk market in Ségou. She re-sells the products both through credit and cash from home to home, at the local markets in her village and the surrounding villages to a customer base mostly comprised of women. She hopes to have a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA [approximately 80 USD] which she will reinvest in her business and take care of the needs of her children. She hopes to become a bulk seller herself of these products with this help from Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: purchase spaghetti

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Baatarhuu is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and and three children in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. Two of his children study at the secondary school. He has been running a wooden products production business since 2005 together with his wife. The business has been successful and there are number of regular customers. The clear income is around 400,000 MNT a month. It is the only financial resource for the family. 

Baatarhuu is a hardworking and talented man who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by buying some necessary materials so the business will earn more." The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy some raw materials.

loans.use: To buy some materials

loans.name: Baby Angel

texts.en:
Baby Angel is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Baby Angel has a poultry business where she raises & sells chickens. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the chickens.

Baby Angel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Baby Angel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her chickens

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married and has eight children. She is 53 years old and resides at Tabid, Ozamis City, Philippines. Corazon plants & harvests root crops such as "kangkong" for sale to earn a living and she's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Corazon wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Virgilio buys & peddles food supplements & vitamins. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy stocks of food supplements  & vitamins.

Virgilio has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Virgilio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food supplements & vitamins

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. She is 48 years old. Estrella is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Estrella is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Estrella has been in her business for 8 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Estrella is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2007, Estrella joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Bhelrey

texts.en:
Bhelrey is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. 

Bhelrey has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He is also a gold dust buyer & seller. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Bhelrey has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Bhelrey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Erma buys & peddles clothes like pants, underwear & blouses. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Erma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar is a 49-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and the children study in college and high school. He started a consumer goods retail business in 1998. Since that time, the business has been successful and Erdenebayar has found many regular customers. The business has been the only financial resource for the family members. 

Erdenebayar is a good-natured man who is responsible for what he is doing and says, "I would like to expand the business activities by buying the supplies in large quantities so that I could improve my household." The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy goods such as cleanser, soup, napkins etc. wholesale.

loans.use: To buy goods such as cleanser, soup, napkins, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Rhoda has a shop that sells snacks like waffles & "binangkal" (sesame seed covered donuts). She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Rhoda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rhoda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with two children. She is 49 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elsa owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Elsa has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Elsa's plan is to save her returns in order to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Jessie has a shop that sells snacks like hotcakes, banana cakes & sweet potato cake. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Jessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is a 48-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Darhan city in Northern Mongolia. His oldest daughter studies at the secondary school. He started painting 2008 and sold his works. With the profits from the business, he bought a sewing machine for his wife. His wife started sewing sleeping bags, mats, and hats in different styles. They sell them at a well-positioned shop counter in a the big trade center. 

Ganzorig is a talented man who says, "I would like to develop our business activity by buying a new sewing machine for the business to keep it successful." The total amount he is requesting is 400,000 MNT to buy a new sewing machine for his wife.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Reika

texts.en:
Reika is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Reika has a food/retail shop or "sari-sari" store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Reika has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Reika hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de chaussures, de poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter  des chaussures, du poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente SANATA,  deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter deux sacs de 100kilos de savons de fabrication locale avec les fournisseurs de Fana pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de savon.
texts.en:
The women of this Benkadi group, all married, have an average age of 37, with on average three children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana. They met each other because they are related, or neighbors and friends. They sell shoes, fish, and soap.  

The women of this Benkadi group are on their third solidarity loan which will be used to buy shoes, fish and soap.
                                                                                                                                                                            
SANATA,  second from the right, intends to buy two sacks of 100 kilograms of locally manufactured soap from suppliers in Fana. It will be sold out of her home to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used for family needs with part reinvested into her soap sales business.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures, de poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures et du poisson.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente DOUSSOU, première personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter  une cinquantaine de paire de chaussures plastique pour adultes et enfants avec les fournisseurs du marché de Fana pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison et en ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  45500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de chaussures.
texts.en:
The women of this Benkadi group, all of them married, have an average age of 39 with four children, and they all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana. 

They met because of being relatives, or neighbors and friends. They sell cooking ingredients, shoes, fish, and soap. The women of this Benkadi group are on their third solidarity loan which will be used to buy cooking ingredients, shoes, and fish.

                                                                                                                                                                                                
DOUSSOU, first on the right, intends to buy about 50 pairs of plastic shoes for adults and children from the suppliers at the Fana market. They will be sold out of her home and also door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,500 F CFA which will be used for family necessities with part reinvested in her shoe sales business.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois, du savon et du poisson.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, du charbon de bois, du savon et du poisson.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente TENIN, au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte   acheter deux sacs de sel, trois paquets de cube magies et deux paquets de vermicelle avec les fournisseurs de Tingolé pour ensuite vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of this Danaya group, all of them married, have an average age of 33 with three children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Tingolé, Sous-Préfecture (county) of Fana. They met because they are related to each other or neighbors or friends. They sell cooking ingredients, charcoal, soap and fish. 
                                                                                                                         
The women of this Danaya group are on their third solidarity loan which will be used to buy cooking ingredients, charcoal, soap, and fish. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                 
TENIN, standing in the middle, intends to buy two sacks of salt, three packets of Maggi cubes, and two packets of fine noodles from the suppliers of  Tingolé which she will sell right in the village to a clientele composed of women and men. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used for family necessities with part reinvested in the sale of cooking ingredients.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is married an has three children. Elpedia is 51 years old. She lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elpedia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer to increase production.

 In 2011, Elpedia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elpedia hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Arturo has a shop wholesaling coconuts for copra & corn grains. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of coconuts for copra & corn grains to sell.

Arturo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Arturo  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of coconuts for copra & corn grains to sell

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a 36-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her two sons study at the high school and her husband is employed. She has been running a food retail business since 2000 in a small town of the province. She sells food products which are for daily use. She also started retailing loud speakers, other such equipment, and computers. She is planning to expand the business by buying the supplies.

 Batjargal is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to develop my business activities further by purchasing necessary equipment for loud speakers and computers so that I can raise my income and save for my sons' college fees." The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo has been engaged in a livestock business for three years. He is 38 years old, married with three children. He is thankful because his wife has been helping him to earn their living, through vending local cakes within the community they live in.

Presently he is raising one sow and 15 piglets.He devotes his time to his livestock business because he would like to nourish them well so that whenever they reach their optimum growth, he can sell them for a higher price.He aims to raise all his 15 piglets, but raising them all is quite hard due to the feed that has to be fed to them daily. So Eduardo is in need of more capital to allow him to buy 15 "cavans" of feed and vaccines. He is asking for a loan of P40,000, and he hopes that he will receive this loan amount so that he can maintain the business, allowing him to obtain greater income to sustain his family needs.

In the business picture, the client is the one wearing a white shirt and the project officer, wearing a jacket, is on the other side.

loans.use: to buy 15 "cavans" (sacks) of  feed and vaccines for raised hogs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is separated and has three children. Norma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and she manages a coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for the cost of farm maintenance.

Norma has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Norma hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai is a 50-year-old man who lives with his wife and two daughters in Selen province in Northern Mongolia. His daughters work at a cafe. He started planting vegetables in 2000. Since 2007 he started to sell his vegetables  in the border cities with his wife's help. He has been running this business with his wife and a son who lives independently from the parents. This has been a really successful business because the profits are high and the demand in different cities makes the business more popular. 

Bayarmagnai is a hard-working man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying a new truck for the business." The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy a new truck.

loans.use: To buy a new truck

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and she is 58 years old. She lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Erlinda owns and operates a plot of farmland, where she plants bananas, root crops and tomatoes to earn a living. She's been in this business for nine years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 7,100 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Erlinda joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2011. In the future, Erlinda's plan is to save her returns in order to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Ochirsuuri

texts.en:
Ochirsuuri is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His children go to the high school. He has been running wood and iron-working  retail business since 2001. Over this period, the business has been successful and his wife started working at the shop counter, selling the products. Ochirsuuri also built a new workplace for the business. 

Ochirsuuri is a talented man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying necessary equipment because the old equipment is broken and needs to be replaced." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy the necessary equipment.

loans.use: To buy equipment necessary for his wood- and metal-working business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is married, 34 years of age, and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental together with her four kids. Rosie is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for nine years and she earns 2,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. 

Rosie's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC in 2006. In the future, Rosie will use her income to support her four kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Rosie wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Bayarnemeh

texts.en:
Bayarnemeh is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her grandmother and her daughter in Arhangai province in Central Mongolia. She has been running a milk products retail business for six years. During this period, she has made many regular customers, not only in her town but also in the neighbouring towns. She plans to develop the business activities further. She produces the milk-made products in summertime and sells them all year round. 

Bayarnemeh is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying supplies like dairy products wholesale so that I can raise the income of my family"". The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy dairy products.

loans.use: To buy dairy products

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Vivian is married and has 6 children.

To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Vivian is requesting a loan of 5,800 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost paid in maintenance and repair of the motorcycle.

In 2008, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and repair of motorcycle.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is a 52-year-old widow, a resident of Liposong, Ozamis City. She provides her 4 children's needs from the little amount of 5,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business she's had for 5 years as an aid to the income gained. However, in 2007 she became a member of GDMPC. She applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Nena wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Belina

texts.en: Belina is a married woman who has 4 children. She is 45 years old, residing at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Belina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 18 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock such as shampoo, soaps, noodles and etc.. In 2009, Belina joined GDMPC. In the future, Belina wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, soaps, noodles and etc.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is married, 52 years of age, and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental together with her 7 kids. Sherlita is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and she earns 5,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 11,100 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Sherlita will use her income to support her 7 kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Sherlita wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Munhtuvshin

texts.en:
Munhtuvshin is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband operates a tire repair center. Her children study at the college and high schools. 

Munhtuvshin has been running a garment retail business for 9 years. She trades the garments to the people when they are at their work. She has a small van which she uses for the garment business. She is a diligent woman who says that "My husband planning to open new tire repair center. We want to develop our business and so we need new equipment. If we could do it, we would continue our business successfully." The total amount she is requesting is 1,300,000 MNT to purchase new equipment for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children study at the high school. She has been running her boots production business since 1993 with her husband. She makes traditional boots in different and excellent styles and trades them at a well-positioned shop counter at 'Narantuul' market, the biggest trade center. She is experienced in the field and recognizes the demand and the changes in the field. Otgonbayar is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by making my workplace bigger than it is now." The total amount she is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to make her workplace bigger.

loans.use: To make the workplace bigger.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, who is married, is 51 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Yolanda owns and operates a plot of farm land, where she plants bananas and root crops to earn a living. She's been in this business for 9 years and earns about PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Yolanda joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2007. In the future, Yolanda's plan is to save her returns in order to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en: Selenge is a 41-year-old man who lives with his wife and son in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife works as a teacher at the secondary school. He has been running a wood and iron made products production business since 1995. He used to do construction work, but then expanded his business activities. Now he prepares different kinds of wooden and iron products for the local people, and they appreciate the things he supplies. He employs two workers in the summertime and does construction work. Selenge is a professional and talented man in the field, and he says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the necessary materials, like wood and iron, in large quantities so that I could continue the business successfully." The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 31 years old and married. She lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Analiza owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living, and she's been 6 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,300 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Analiza wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Cherlita

texts.en:
Cherlita is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

She has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Cherlita wants to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 51 years old and has 3 children. She is married and has 2 children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.  She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for dressmaking. In the future, Laura would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials for dress making.

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Luvisminda works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling fermented shrimps business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fermented shrimps. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. Luvisminda hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fermented shrimps.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 6 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Ma. Christina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Marlyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Marlyn runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marlyn has been in this business for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as eggs, spices, noodles, bread, etc.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, snack foods, spices, etc.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is 57 years old and married with three children.

Rosela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Rosela has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from food-vending and electronic re-loading.

Rosela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 51 years old and married with four children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for her family.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as milk, coffee, sugar, soap, etc.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ruth has been in this business for four years. Ruth earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.en:
Tazagul is married but doesn’t have any children. 

She has been involved in her cattle-breeding business for 20 years. She sells the milk products at the village and the calves to the butchers. She owns the area where she plants potatoes and keeps chickens in her yard.

Tazagul wants to obtain 1,000 Azerbaijan new manats (AZN) to buy two calves. The income from the expansion of the business will be very useful for her family.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Ruvelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Ruvelyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Ruvelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rachel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her food stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a hardware store and sells gas cylinders to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. Genalyn has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old, married and has two children. 

He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed two people. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. 

He has applied for 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 30, 26 and 20. 

In 2002, Kadiatu established her motor vehicle spare parts business. She began her business because there was no one to take care of her schooling. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 980,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more spare parts, like oil filters, clutch plates and engine oil, in a very large quantity.  In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a bigger outlet to be managed by her husband.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Dembereldorj

texts.en:
Dembereldorj, 46, runs a small computer game center in a rental house. Actually, his main job is as a driver and he provides passengers with intercity transportation. But he wanted to start a second business - a computer game center. He has been running his new business for half a year. At first, he started it with just three personal computers and now he owns six computers. He tries to expand his business day by day.
