Angélica’s goal is to have her own house because she’s currently living with her in-laws; this is why profits from the sale of her sheep will be to build her house.

She is very grateful to FRAC and to KIVA for the loan they’ve granted her because with it she’ll be able to improve her and her children’s quality of life.  

The entire group in general is very grateful for the loan granted which will be invested in their various activities; Lucrecia in a tire repair shop, Elia will buy chicks, Adela in her grocery store, Inés will buy clothes, Graciela in her store and stationery shop, Mónica in clothes, Ángeles in her recycling center, Víctor and Carmen in sheep.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and with what's left over, grass.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1962 à Coré, Salimata vit avec ses 8 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Salimata s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Salimata, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de produits alimentaires : patates douces, igname, pomme de terre et banane plantain.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, Salimata est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  120 sacs de pomme de terre et 50 sacs de patate douce. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Sikasso et sur place à Ouelessebougou et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou à une clientèle mixte. 
Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1962 in Coré, Salimata lives with her 8 children and husband in a nuclear family in Ouelessebougou. 

Due to her social background, Salimata was unable to go to school. She quickly became interested in income-generating activities alongside her mother who sold basic foodstuffs. After numerous years of experience in this area, Salimata decided to buy and sell grocery items: sweet potatoes, yams, potatoes, and plantains. 

After having properly reimbursed two previous loans, Salimata has a third loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She'll use this loan to buy 120 sacks of potatoes and 50 sacks of sweet potatoes. She buys supplies from the wholesalers of Sikasso and also in Ouelessebougou. She sells in cash, credit, and at retail to a mixed clientele at the Ouelessebougou market.
 
Salimata hopes to make profits of 80.000FCFA, which she'll use to help her husband meet the needs of the family, reimburse the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Cuatro Caminos Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Cuatro caminos", y se encuentra localizado en la localidad de San Nicolás Guadalupe en el municipio de San Felipe del Progreso, es una comunidad con mucha vegetación y su gente son personas muy amables y trabajadoras, ellas decidieron nombrarle de esta forma a su grupo porque en el lugar donde ellas se reúnen para hacer sus pagos hay una "t" son cuatro caminos y ellos lo relacionan con la vida pues dicen que en la vida hay varios caminos, en el que cada uno elige el que quiere, si en uno le va mal no se quedan estancados, se van por otro mejor, ellas son muy optimistas y tienen mucha visión sobre la vida, este grupo lo conforman siete mujeres muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante, sus nombres y actividades son las siguientes:
1.- María Guadalupe G. (COMPRA DE MERCANCIA PARA LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ROPA PARA VENDER)
2.- Cecilia C. (COMPRA DE POLLOS, ALIMENTO, MAIZ, TELA, HILOS PARA BORDAR Y VENDER)
3.- Verónica L. (COMPRA DE POLLOS, ALIMENTO, MAIZ y BORDADOS PARA VENDER)
4.- María Luisa E. (COMPRA DE DULCES, PELOTAS, CHICHARRONES PARA VENDER)
5.- Francisca L. (COMPRA DE MERCANCIA PARA LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ROPA, TELA PARA ELABORAR LA ROPA Y VENDER)
6.- María Micaela C. (COMPRA DE MERCANCIA PARA LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES)
7.- Ana S. (COMPRA DE CUADRIEL, HILOS PARA BORDAR Y VENDER)

Cecilia es la representante del grupo cuatro caminos, ella tiene 33 años de edad, y está casada con el señor Apolonio, con el que tiene 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y solicita su crédito para la compra de pollos, alimento, maíz, tela, e hilos para bordar y vender, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de los pollos y a la elaboración de servilletas, en esta actividad ella tiene una experiencia de 6 años, años en los que se ha visto beneficiada por su actividad, ella compra sus pollos con los polleros que pasan ofreciendo, cuando aún son pequeños, posteriormente los cría en su casa y cuando crecen los vende, sus telas e hilos los compra en su municipio, de esta manera se lleva su material a su casa y en sus tiempos libres es cuando ella se dedica a elaborar sus servilletas con muy bonitos bordados, posteriormente cuando las ha terminado ella se las ofrece a sus conocidas. La señora Cecilia anteriormente se había estancado a falta de dinero, pero cuando se acercó a los préstamos fue cuando encontró un impulso a su economía. "La cosa es no rendirse y ocupar tu tiempo en algo productivo, y saber invertir bien tu dinero" dice la señora Cecilia.
texts.en:
The following group is called “Cuatro Caminos” (Four Roads) and is located in the town of San Nicolás Guadalupe in the municipality of San Felipe del Progreso. It is a community with a lot of vegetation and the people are hardworking and friendly. They decided on the name of their group because at the place where they meet to make their payments there is a “t” of four roads and they relate this with life because they say in life there are various roads, and each one chooses the one they like, and if things go poorly don’t stay bogged-down, go a better way. They are all very optimistic and they have a good view of life. This group is made up of seven hardworking women, eager to get ahead, and their names and activities are as follows:

1.  María Guadalupe G. (to buy merchandise for her grocery store and clothes to sell)
2.  Cecilia C. (to buy chickens, feed, corn, fabric and embroidery thread to sell)
3.  Verónica L. (to buy chickens, feed, corn, and embroidered pieces to sell)
4.  María Luisa E. (to buy sweets, balls, and pork cracklings to sell)
5.  Francisca L. (to buy supplies for her grocery store, and clothing, and thread for embroidering clothing to sell
6.  María Micaela C. (to buy supplies for her grocery store)
7.  Ana S. (to buy quadrilles and thread for embroidery to sell)

Cecilia is the representative of the group Cuatro Caminos. She is 33 years old and is married to Apolonio, and they have 3 children who are currently school students. She is a hardworking woman and she is asking for a loan in order to buy chickens, feed, corn, fabric and thread for embroidering and selling; she already works selling chickens and she embroiders napkins. She has 6 years experience in this work, years in which she has seen benefit for her work. She buys her chickens from chicken farmers passing by, when they are still little, and then she raises them in her home and when they are grown she sells them. She buys her fabric and thread in her municipality, and she takes it home and in her free time she works embroidering napkins with very pretty results, and later when she has finished she offers them to acquaintances. Cecilia used to be immobilized due to a lack of money, but when she stepped up for funding she found a surge to her economy. “The thing is to not give up and to use your time on something productive, and to know how to invest your money wisely,” says Cecilia.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, corn, fabric and embroidery thread in order to sell items

loans.name: Delfines Group

texts.es: Abraham tiene 30 años de edad el estudio una carrera técnica y dice que ya no continuo con sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, el es parte del grupo Delfines y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque se sienten libres de trabajar con la financiera aparte de que son unos animales muy inteligentes. El está casado con la señora Jessica la cual le ayuda a atender la tienda de bisutería y regalos, ellos tienen dos niñas una de 6 años la cual estudia la primaria y la menor de tres años. Abraham está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pulseras, aretes de pedrería, anillos, gargantillas, corsetería, juguetes y regalos ya que tiene un local desde hace 6 años el cual renta muy cerca del centro de su población. Dice que uno de sus sueños es vender plata porque es un buen negocio y un poco mas de papelería y regalos, dice que el sale a surtir su mercancía en la ciudad de México ya que allá le dan un buenos precios y así ganarle un poco mas a las cosas que vende. El esta  muy agradecido por los créditos que le ha hecho la financiera por que su negocio a crecido y eso tiene muy contento. Las otras nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Elsa, Ma. Eusebia, Blanca, Inés, Linda, Susana, Carlota, Angelina y María del Carmen todas ellas invertirán sus créditos en ventas de ropa y calzado para dama por catalogo, insumos para una torteria, artículos domésticos, insumos para venta de hamburguesas, frutas y legumbres de temporada,  y corsetería.
texts.en: Abraham is 30 and studied for a technical career.  He said he didn't continue with his studies due to the lack of economic resources.  He is part of the "Delfines" [Dolphins] group.  He says they named their group that because they feel free to work with financing apart from being very intelligent animals.  He is married to Jessica, who helps him attend to his costume jewelry and gift store.  They have 2 girls.  One is 6 and is in elementary school, and the youngest is 3.  Abraham is requesting a loan to buy bracelets, jewel earrings, rings, necklaces, lingerie, toys, and gifts.  He has rented a location for 6 years very near the center of town.  He says that one of his dreams is to sell silver because it's a good business and is a little more than stationery and gifts.  He says that he goes to Mexico City to buy merchandise since they give him good prices there, and he can earn a little more on the items he sells.  He is very thankful for the loans he has received because his business has grown, and that makes him very happy.  The other 9 members of the group are Elsa, María Eusebia, Blanca, Inés, Linda, Susana, Carlota, Angelina, and María del Carmen.  All of them will invest their loans in their businesses, where they sell women's clothing sales by catalog, sandwiches, housewares, hamburgers, seasonal fruits and vegetables, and lingerie.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, jewel earrings, rings, necklaces, lingerie, toys, and gifts.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Gerardo le esta haciendo falta la techo en una cuarto y desea construirlo de concreto para que sea mas duradero y seguro. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es arena, cemente, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Gerardo es empleado de una fabrica en el departamento de control de calidad en el turno de noche, y su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora en el aria de producción, entres los dos ingresos son para solventar las gastos familiares y escolares de sus cuatro hijos que tiene, dos hombre que están estudiando la secundaría y dos mujercitas que estudian la primaria. 
Desea que sus dos hijos barones tengan su propio espacio en la casa, y mejorar la calidad de vida y el patrimonio de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo's house needs a roof in one room and he wants to construct it of concrete so it will be more durable and secure.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy the material, which is sand, cement, and rods, and to pay the person who will make the improvement.

Gerardo works the night shift in the quality control department of a factory, and his wife works in a "maquiladora" [foreign-owned assembly plant] in the area of production.  Between the two incomes they pay for the family expenses and the school expenses of their four children, two boys who are in secondary school and two little girls in elementary school.

He wants his two male children to have their own space in the house and to improve the quality of life and the patrimony of the entire family.

loans.use: to make a concrete slab in a room.

loans.name: Barrio Capilla Vieja Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es uno de los integrantes de un grupo llamado Barrio Capilla vieja los mienbros del grupo lo han llamado asi por que es el nombre de su colonia, este grupo tiene 7 integrantes cada uno de ellos tiene una actividad economica la cual desempeñan para ganar un poco de dinero y dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado a la orrilla de una laguna por lo cual su gente se dedica a la pesca. 

Doña mmargarita tiene la edad de 46 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijos. Ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a trabajar y desde que tuvo a sus hijos trabaja mas duro para sacarlos a delante, doña Margarita desde hace un poco mas de 3 años abrió una pequeña de abarrotes en su hogar con la intención de tener mas ingresos en su familia y comenta que gracias a Dios poco a poco a ganado clientela, a ella siempre le gusta tener surtido su negocio y dar buena atención a sus clientes para que siempre vuelvan a hacerle el  gasto, ella invertira este credito en la compra de jabon, arroz, sopa, aceite, frijol, sal, azucar, productos enlatados,dulces y refrescos dulces para resurtir su negocio y continuar con sus venta. 
ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando ya que desea que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar la universidad. 

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Eusebia venta de dulces 
Gloria venta de antojitos 
Sabina venta de pescado 
Olga venta de ropa 
Martha papeleria 
Olivia venta de ropa

este grupo agradece a fundacion el credito y apoyo que se le ha brindado
texts.en:
Margarita is one of the members of a group called  Barrio Capilla Vieja. The members of the group called it that because that is the name of their neighborhood. The group has 7 members. Each of them has an economic activity they do to make a little money and give their families a better quality of life. This group is located on the shores of a lake and the people there fish.   

Margarita is 46 years old. She only went to primary school and is the single mother of two children. She tells us that since she was very young her mother taught her to work and since she had her children she has worked even harder to get them ahead.  A little more than 3 years ago, Margarita opened a small store in her home in order to make more income for her family. She tells us that thank God, little by little she has earned customers. She always likes to have her business well stocked and to give her customers good service so they will always go back to buy from her. She will invest this loan in buying soap, rice, oil, beans, salt, sugar, canned products, candies and sugared drinks to re-stock her business and continue selling.   She wants for this investment to keep her business progressing since she wants her children to have the chance to go to college.   
 

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Eusebia- selling candies 
Gloria-selling snacks 
Sabina-selling fish 
Olga-selling clothes 
Martha-selling paper
Olivia-selling clothes

este grupo agradece a fundacion el credito y apoyo que se le ha brindado

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, soup, beans, salt, sugar, canned products, candies, and sugared beverages.

loans.name: Hediliza Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Hediliza tiene 46 años de edad, es separada con 03 hijos en etapa escolar. Ella empezó trabajando  brindando servicio de limpieza y cocina, lo que pudo ahorrar para emprender su propio negocio, pues actualmente cuenta con una tienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Ella  se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo  a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. A futuro a Hediliza le gustaría poner una boutique, la cual le permitirá tener un ingreso mas para su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y leche y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda. Hediliza agradece el crédito brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Hediliza, 46, is separated with three school-age children.  She began working offering cleaning and cooking services.  She saved what she could to launch her own business.  Currently she has a store where she sells basic household necessities.  She is proud because thanks to her effort she has been able to get her children ahead.  In the future Hediliza would like to install a boutique, which will allow her to have an additional income for her household.

She requested the loan this time to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk, to stock her store.  Hediliza is grateful for the loan offered because it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora Lidia vive junto a su esposo Severino y sus cuatro hijos en la zona de Alto San Isidro que esta ubicado a treinta minutos del centro de la cuidad. Lidia se dedica a la venta de víveres a crédito como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar y aceite. Pero ella no reparte estos víveres en la cuidad sino que ella los lleva a las localidades y pueblos fuera de la cuidad, por ejemplo al pueblo de los padres de su esposo. Esta actividad que ella tiene es agotadora ya que tienen que realizar un largo viaja hasta estos pueblos y tiene que cargar y descargar la mercadería que lleva.  Por otro lado el Sr. Severino trabaja como albañil contratista. Ellos actualmente viven en casa familiar de los padres pero quieren llegar a ahorrar suficiente dinero para comprar una casa propia.  En esta oportunidad lidia solicita el préstamo de dinero para el incremento de su capital con la compra de arroz, fideo y azúcar, Lidia es una persona fuerte y trabajadora se siente feliz por al oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Lidia lives with her husband Severino and their four children in the area of Alto San Isidro, located thirty minutes from the center of town. Lidia sells groceries on credit, such as rice, pasta, sugar, and oil. She doesn't deliver the groceries in the city but takes them to the towns outside the city. For example, she goes to the town where her husband's parents' town. This activity she has is exhausting since she has to travel far to the towns and has to load and unload the merchandise. Severino works as a bricklayer contractor. They live in her parents' family home but want to save enough money to buy their own home. At this time, Lidia is asking for the loan to increase her capital by buying rice, pasta, and sugar. Lidia is a strong and hardworking person and is happy for the opportunity being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and pasta wholesale.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Los  integrantes del grupo siguen en su negocio que viene desarrollando. La joven Erika tiene 21 años de edad, ella es casada tiene un hijo varón de 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar unos cerditos y alimento para cerdos, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años por su esposo que le gustan los animales, él le enseño a alimentar y el cuidado de los cerdos, su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene cuando vende los cerdos, a ella le gusta ver que los cerdos van creciendo y están gorditos, ella utiliza las ganancias para comprar cerdos y alimento. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que crezcan  y que se logren los cerdos y que tosa la familia este bien y no se enfermen. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamo, nos ayudan a crecer los negocios y a seguir trabajando  y que sigan ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
The members of the group continue in their businesses.  Erika, a 21-year-old young woman, is married and has a two-year-old male son.  She works raising and selling pigs.  She requested her loan to buy some young pigs and pig feed.  She started her business two years ago because of her husband, who likes animals.  He taught her to feed and care for the pigs.  Her business is important because of the profits she gets when she sells the pigs.  She likes to see the pigs grow and get fat.  She uses the profits to buy pigs and feed.

Her dreams and hopes are for the pigs to grow and achieve, and for her entire family to be well and not get sick.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you very much for your loans.  They help us to grow our businesses and to continue working and helping more people who need it."

loans.use: to buy pigs and food to raise them.

loans.name: America Rosana

texts.es: America de 32 años vive machalaecuador). Ella decdio ponerse un salón de belleza porque su esposo decidió incribirla en un curso de belleza . y entonces como ya sabia decidió ponerse en su domicilio el salón de belleza . trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas con su hija . A futuro anhela tener su casa arreglada. Con el préstamo comprara ( tijeras, maquillaje, cosmeticos
texts.en: America, 32, lives in Machala, Ecuador.  She decided to open a beauty salon because her husband decided to enroll her in a beauty course and since she knew how she decided to open a beauty salon at home.  She works every day with much effort and dedication for her daughter.  In the future she’d like to have her house fixed up nicely.  She will use the loan to buy scissors, make-up and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy scissors, make-up and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vany Manuel

texts.es: Vany Manuel es un emprendedor que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 con crédito durante este ciclo ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y con sueños en la vida de ver su negocio bien establecido y brindarle a su familia siempre lo mejor. Nos expresa el emprendedor que tiene bastantes clientes que le solicitan productos que ya tiene varios encargos y actualmente está nuevamente solicitando crédito para invertir en la compra de variedad de pescado y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vany Manuel is an entrepreneur who’s been working with Fundación León 2000 with credit during this cycle and has shown himself to be a responsible person with dreams in his life to see his business well established and to provide his family with the best always.

He expresses to us that he has many customers who request products and he has several pending orders.  He is currently asking for a loan once again to buy an assortment of fish to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fish.

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es: Doña Emma tiene 38 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad llamada san Felipe de los Alzati donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo de flor de noche buena y al cultivo de de aguacate ya que la tierra es muy prolifera para el cultivo de este fruto. Ella tiene una huerta de aguacate desde hace mas de 15 años y dice que entre su esposo y ella han sacado adelante este huerto para así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Platica que cuando es temporada de cosecha sale a vender a la central de abastos desde muy temprana hora y a veces los vende en el mercado de una población cercana a de ella, los vende por bolsitas. Ahorita ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos, fertilizantes, calidra e insecticidas y que con los fuertes aires que han azotado a su comunidad se le ha pegado una plaga de arañitas que desgraciadamente no dejan que crezcan en buen estado los frutos y es por eso que le urge el crédito para eliminar ese tipo de plagas. Dice que gracias al crédito mantendrá en muy buen estado su huerta y con las ganancias que obtenga dice que ahorrara para en el mes de octubre y noviembre comprar flor de noche buena y revenderla en el Estado  de México. Las otras 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman María Verónica, María Angélica y Graciela ellas invertirán en insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos, en frutas y legumbres de temporada y en trastes de plástico para su venta.
texts.en:
Emma, 38, is from a place called San Felipe de los Alzati where most of the residents work growing poinsettias and avocadoes since the soil is very fertile for this type of crops.

She’s had an avocado orchard for more than 15 years and she says that between her and her husband they’ve moved the orchard ahead in order to have better quality of life.  She relates that when it’s harvest time she heads out to the wholesale foodstuffs market very early to sell and sometimes she sells them in the market in a town nearby; she sells them by the little bagful.

She’s asking for a loan now to buy organic manure, fertilizer, Calidra [brand of hydrated lime powder] and insecticide because due to the strong wind that’s buffeted her community an infestation of little spiders has attached that don’t let the fruit develop well and this is why the loan is urgently needed to eliminate this type of infestation.  She says that thanks to the loan she’ll be able to keep her orchard in good condition and with profits obtained she says she’ll save up so that in October and November she will buy poinsettias to resell in the state of México.

The other three group members are called María Verónica, María Angélica and Graciela.  They will invest in ingredients to make Mexican fast food snacks, in seasonal fruit and vegetables and in plastic dinnerware to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, Calidra and organic manure for her avocado orchard.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and has two children.  She is 54 years old and resides in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Victoria owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. 

Victoria requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to grow.   Victoria joined GDMPC in 2011.  In the future, Victoria wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Divine Grace

texts.en: Divine Grace is a 22-year-old married woman with a 2-year-old child. Her husband works as a driver. Divine sells food items to her community in Dauis, Bohol. She sells banana and camote (sweet potato) cue, pancakes and rice cakes. Divine is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and bananas. She hopes for her business to grow and she will be able to save for her child's future education.

loans.use: buy sugar, flour, cooking oil and bananas

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is a married woman with three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Merlinda owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase farm chemicals.  Merlinda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Merlinda's plan is to save her returns in order to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Graciana

texts.en:
Graciana is 51 years old and is a married woman with 6 children with ages between 17 and 25. She started her sari-sari store business 2 years ago. She sells snacks, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and various other items. Graciana is able to help provide for her family's daily needs through her business.

Graciana is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as softdrinks, snacks and canned goods. She hopes for sari-sari store to grow and for her children to finish college and become successful.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman who has 8 children. Edna is 57 years old and resides in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. Edna owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 from her business. 

Edna requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Edna wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 children.

To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Wilma sells door to door to her "suki" buyers (regular customers). Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Wilma is requesting a loan of 4,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for making "bibingka". Bibingka is a rice cake (usually plate-size, yellowish and flat). It is served in a mold lined with banana leaves. 

Recently, Wilma joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance for additional investment in her business. She plans to use some of the income generated to expand her business and a portion will be saved for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making "bibingka"

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 43 years old.  She resides in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. Maricel is operating a fishing business venture. She sells the fish which her husband caught from the ocean. She's been in this business for 15 years and gets PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business. 

Maricel requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  Maricel joined GDMPC in 2008.  In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella, married, is 54 years old and resides in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Estrella owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy items such as shampoo, milk, food, etc. In 2008, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Estrella hopes for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, milk, food, etc.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Leidys

texts.es: Leidys de 31 años vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 14 años. Allí tiene dos negocios, por un lado se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada mediante guías especializadas,  con las que promociona artículos de perfumería y cosméticos y por otro lado se dedica a la producción de comidas rápidas en su propio barrio y en los alrededores. Su negocio lo inició desde hace 7 años, para fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar, hasta en ese momento a cargo de su cónyuge. Las mercancías que vienen en sus catálogos la vende directamente ella, mientras las comidas rápidas lo hacen apoyada por sus hijos,  los días jueves y domingos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumes, cremas, bisutería, que están en descuento en sus guías especializadas y tienen muchos pedidos y también invertirá en comprar en mayor cantidad,  insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas rápidas, como embutidos productos de panadería, salsa etc. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para lograr el crecimiento al que ella aspira y esta es justamente la razón por la cual su credikiva tendrá éxito.
texts.en:
Leidys, 31, lives in the municipality of Soledad with her spouse and three children whose ages range between 10 and 14 years.  She has two businesses there.  On the one hand she sells various merchandise via specialized catalogues; she sells perfumes and cosmetics that way.  On the other hand, she also makes fast food in her own neighborhood and adjacent areas.  She started her business 7 years ago to strengthen her home’s wellbeing which up to that time was entirely her spouse’s responsibility. The merchandise in her catalogues she sells directly herself while the fast food is prepared with help from her children Thursdays and Sundays.  

She is applying for Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry that are on special discount in her catalogues and for which she has many pending orders; she will also buy in larger amounts the ingredients she needs to make her fast food like cured meats, baked goods, sauces, etc.  Her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital to attain the growth she aspires to and this is precisely the reason why her Kiva loan will be successful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and ingredients to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un hombre de 47 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos a cargo. Vive en la casa propia de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la zona urbana y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.
La actividad que realiza Martín es el transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi (vehículo de tres ruedas con una cubierta de plástico grueso e impermeable), vehículo que es propio y que cuenta con todos los permisos y papeles en orden para su tránsito. Además, realiza actividades de carpintería en su taller ubicado en el domicilio de sus padres. Martin y su madre apoyan con los gastos de la casa mutuamente.
El monto del crédito asciende a 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales estarán destinados para el mantenimiento y limpieza de su unidad móvil, en este caso, su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Martín is a 47 year old man, single and with no children in his care.  He lives in his parents’ house located in Tambogrande District.  He lives in the urban zone and has all basic utilities.

The activity that Martín does is passenger transportation service in a mototaxi (a three wheel vehicle with a thick, impermeable plastic top) which is his and has all required licenses and papers in order in order to circulate.  In addition, he also does carpentry jobs in a workshop located in his parents’ house.  Martín and his mother share household expenses.

The loan is for 1500 new soles which will be used to clean and service his mototaxi.

loans.use: to clean and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 51-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between 15 and 28. Her husband works as a driver. Juanita is a meat vendor. She particularly sells pork meat to her community in Dauis, Bohol. She earns 4000 PHP per month from this business. 

Juanita is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and food containers.  She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: buy pigs and food containers

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en: Agapita is married, 44 years of age, and lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Misamis Occidental together with her 4 children. Agapita operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 5 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Agapita will use her income to support her 4 children in their studies until they finish college and also provide for their daily needs. Agapita wishes that her business will be more progressive.

loans.use: buy goods for her store

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is a 63-year-old married woman from Dauis, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman. Gliceria is a food vendor. She sells cassavas and pancakes to her community. She earns 2000 PHP per month doing this business.

Gliceria is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as cassava, sugar, coconut milk. Gliceria hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to renovate their house soon.

loans.use: buy cassavas, sugar and coconut milk

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 42-year-old married woman with 2 children ages 14 and 15. Her husband is a fisherman.

Vilma is a fish vendor. She earns 3000 PHP per month selling fish to her community in Dauis, Bohol. Vilma does her best to support her family, especially her children's education. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marlynda

texts.en:
Marlynda is 46 years old and is a married woman with 3 children ages 9, 15 and 18. Her husband works as a farmer. She makes roofing materials out of nipa palm leaves. Marlynda has had this business for 16 years. She earns about 8,000 PHP per month selling nipa roofing materials.

Marlynda is requesting a loan to buy more materials such as nipa and uway (a type of rattan palm). Marlynda hopes to have a stable income and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as nipa and uway

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 62 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre ya que en todas las reuniones que hace el grupo les hace amena su reunión platica que estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria porque sus padres no tenían los recursos para mandarla a la escuela ya que eran 11 hermanos. 
Ella es parte del grupo Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo y dice que decidieron ponerle ese nombre al grupo porque esa flor les gusta a la mayoría de las integrantes y el segundo nombre es porque así se llama su colonia. Leo como de cariño le dicen está casada y vive sola con su esposo ya que sus hijos son casados, doña Leo como de cariño le dice la gente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y artículos para el hogar por catalogo desde hace mas de 20 años, ella emprendió este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su casa  y dice que a ella le gusta lo que hace ya que así a conocido a mucha gente que le ofrece a sus productos, además ella ha ayudado a mucha gente a tener un empleo a través de su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catalogo y eso la llena de orgullo en su trabajo. 
Leonarda esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar perfumes, cosméticos etc., que tiene ya pedidos por sus clientas y que no ha podido sacar porque no ha tenido capital para comprar y venderlos a sus clientas. La meta que tiene la señora Leo es poner un local estable ya que a su edad se cansa de andar en las calles ofreciendo sus productos de belleza. Platica que esta contenta de trabajar con la financiera por que no le cobran altos intereses, dice que las demás compañeras de su grupo se llaman Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Angélica, Irma, Adelina, Jarintzi todas ellas invertirán en sus negocios como una pastelería, en una tienda de abarrotes, ropa para damas caballeros y niños, pollo para venderlo por kilos, venta de cosméticos por catalogo y calzado para dama, caballeros y niños y ropa por catalogo.
texts.en:
Leonarda, 62, is a very hardworking, cheerful woman who makes all the group meetings pleasant.  She relates that she only studied up to sixth grade in elementary school because her parents did not have the resources to send her to school because they were 11 siblings.

She is part of the “Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo” (Pueblo Nuevo Easter Lilies) group and they decided on this name because most of the group likes this flower and the other part is because that’s the name of their neighborhood.

Doña Leo, like she’s affectionately called, is married and lives just with her husband because all her children are now married.  Leo sells cosmetics, perfume and items for the home via catalogue.  She’s been in business more than 20 years.  She started the business to help her husband cover household expenses and she says that she likes what she does because she’s met a lot of people selling her products.  Besides, she has helped many people get jobs through the catalogue cosmetic sales business and that fills her with pride in her work.

Leonarda is asking for a loan to buy perfume, cosmetics, etc. because she has pending customer orders that she’s been unable to fill because she’s not had capital to buy them and resell to her customers.  Leo’s goal is to set up a stable site to sell because at her age she gets tired going through the streets offering her beauty products.

She relates that she’s happy to work with the financial institution because they don’t charge high interest rates.  She says that the other group members are called Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Angélica, Irma, Adelina and Jarintzi and they will all invest in their business such as a bakery, a grocery store, clothing for women, men and children, chicken to sell by the kilogram, catalogue cosmetics sales and footwear sales for women, men and children via catalogue.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama 5 de mayo  que se integra de cinco personas quienes se dedican a la  bordado de mantas  y se ubica en  el barrio llamado barrio centro ajilho.

    Quine se le tomo la entrevista se llama Josefa quien  vive en unión libre con el señor Lucas con quien procreo cuatro hijos quienes esta a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de matas para elaborar blusas y camisas bordadas en donde lleva trabajando veinte un años en la que comenta que le va bien ya que  con ello a estado sacando adelante ha su familia

    Inicio con esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  en donde y ya  es trabajo  de las señoras que viven en esa comunidad.

    Lo que desea es aumentar  cada día mas su actividad para seguir adelante con su familia y la ayuda de su esposo.

   Quienes integran en el grupo son: Lorenzo quien invertirá en la compra de mantas, Reynaldo  invertirá el préstamo  en la compra y venta de camisas y blusas artesanales, Lucas invertirá en prendas artesanales y  Manuel invertirá en la elaboración de camisas de mantas
texts.en:
This group is called “The Fifth of May”. It is made up of five people who work sewing the finished edges on blankets. They live in a neighborhood called the “Ajilho” neighborhood.
Josefa was selected for this interview. She lives with Mr. Lucas, with whom she has had four children, who are her responsibility. She is asking for this loan in order to buy embroidery supplies in order to embroider blouses and shirts with borders. She has been doing this work for the past twenty-one years. The work is going well. With the income from this work she is able to help her family succeed.
She started this work in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Also it is the type of work that the women do in her community. What she would like to do is to grow her business each day in order to help her family and her husband.
They members of the group are: Lorenzo, who will use the loan to buy blankets, Reynaldo, who will use this loan to buy and sell folk art shirts and blouses, Lucas, who will buy folk crafts, and Manuel, who will make ponchos.

loans.use: to buy blankets and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is a 36-year-old woman who is married with three sons and two daughters. For the past six years, she has been doing different types of embroidery and selling the goods to shops and customers upon their request. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Shadia is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more textiles, thread, and beads, which are necessary for her to complete her work. This will enable her to maximize the number of embroidered goods that she makes, which will increase her sales and improve the family's income.

Shadia is photographed above in her house with some of her embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, thread, and beads.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda is a married woman with 3 children. Luzminda is 44 years old, residing at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Luzminda operates a fishing business venture, selling seafood products including fish, crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase more fish to sell. In 2008, Luzminda joined GDMPC. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 13, 18 and 23. She sells viands to her community in Dauis, Bohol. Norma goes around her neighborhood to sell food. She earns 200 PHP daily with her business.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as pork & chicken, vegetables and spices. Norma hopes this loan will help grow her business. She also hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as pork and chicken, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат - женщина 50 лет, мать четверых детей,ее муж  работает мастером по ремонту домов.Сама Рохат работает продавцом в кондитерском ларьке, в центре города.Она продаёт торты и разнообразные кондитерские изделия.Продукция данного цеха очень вкусная и качественная, поэтому у Рохат продажа всегда в разгаре.Она кредитуется уже второй год, и на следующий кредит хочет продолжить ремонт дома, который был начат при получении предыдущего займа.Мастеров Рохат не нанимает, т.к. её муж сам справляется с ремонтом.Рохат хочет покрыть крышу металлическим шифером, т.к такая крыша более водостойкая и прочная.
texts.en:
Rohat is a 50-year old woman, the mother of four. Her husband works as a house repair contractor. Rohat sells pastry from a sales booth located downtown. She sells cakes and various pastries.
 
Rohat has been taking out loans for  over a year. She would like to use her next credit to continue making her house repairs initiated with the prior loan. The shop [she works for] bakes delicious, high-quality cakes, which is why Rohat always gets many customers. Rohat does not employ contractors because her husband handles the work himself. Rohat would like to have metal slate roofing installed since this type of roofing is watertight and more dependable.

loans.use: to make house repairs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un hombre de 33 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos como carga familiar. Vive en la casa de su padre, en caserío Hualtaco II, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio básico de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Martín es la crianza de animales como actividad principal y a la agricultura como actividad complementaria, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace más de  6 años, además cuenta con  0,5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola sembrados de limón, los cuales fueron heredados por su padre. Además Martín cuenta con ingresos extras ya que labora como vigilante en la junta de usuarios en el CPMe Cruceta.
El monto del crédito a entregar es de 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos para la compra de abono para la mejor cosecha del limón y la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y así seguir creciendo en su negocio lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martin is a 33-year-old man. He is single and doesn’t have dependent children. He lives with his father, in the “Hualtaco II” neighborhood in the “Tambogrande” district. He lives in a rural part of this district, but there is electricity there.
Martin’s primary job is raising animals. He complements this job with agriculture. He has been doing this work for the past six years. He has a half hectacre of agricultural land where he grows lemons. He inherited this land from his father. Also Martin earns additional income as a guard for the people at “CPMe Cruceta”.
He is requesting a loan for 2,000 new soles, which he will use to buy fertilizer so that he has a better crop of lemons. He also will buy food to be used to fatten his cattle. He will then get a better price for his cattle and be able to continue growing his business, which will help him improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops and to buy balanced food for his cattle.

loans.name: Hadbaatar

texts.en: Hadbaatar is a 33-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. His daughters go to secondary school and kindergarten. His wife operates a sewing business. He started a taxi service business in 2009. Now he runs a cargo business with his truck. He has many customers in the town and the surrounding areas. But due to the bad roads in the countryside, the truck trailer has broken down. Hadbaatar is a responsible man who says: "I would like to expand the business activity by making the truck trailer repaired. I want to continue the business successful."  The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to repair his truck trailer.

loans.use: To repair his truck trailer

loans.name: Gombojav

texts.en: Gombojav is a 46-year-old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His 3 children study at college and in high school. Gombojav started his food selling business in 2005 and in 2006 he start to operate a cafeteria. Also, in 2010, he started renting a shop counter where he sells underwear, children clothes etc. He has a truck with which he brings the supplies. He sees market demand and works out the appropriate plan for the business. Gombojav is a diligent man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the supplies in large quantities so that I could increase income". The total amount he is requesting is 700,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à Ségou, Hawa vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à Kolondièba ville. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Hawa s’est vite intéressés aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des articles divers  tels les produits de beauté,  les  pagnes, les  savons,  les céréales etc.    
Hawa est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, deux gros colis composés de  1 carton de mèches, 4 savons, 1 carton de thé et 1 sac du sucre. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des revendeurs de Kolondièba et effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail, à domicile, dans les foires  de Fakola et Farako à une clientèle mixte. 
Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Hawa was born around 1976 in Ségou. She lives with her children and husband in a nuclear family in the town of Kolondieba.

She never had the opportunity to attend school and early on she was involved in income generating activities, particularly, the sale of various items such as beauty products, “pagnes” [traditional wrap around fabric], soaps, cereals etc.

This is Hawa’s first loan with Soro Yiriwaso and she will use it to buy two large packages made up of 1 box of extensions, 4 soaps, 1 box of tea and 1 bag of sugar. She gets her supplies from resellers in Kolondieba and sells retail for cash to a mixed clientele at home or in the fairs of Fakola and Farako.

Hawa hopes to make a monthly profit of 75, 000 francs CFA which will be used to help her husband provide for the family’s needs, to reimburse her loan and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to purchase various items.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo es un hombre de 22 años, conviviente y sin hijos. Vive en el domicilio de sus padres, ubicado en el Caserío San Pedrillo, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Dicho domicilio sólo cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad que realiza consiste en el traslado de personas en una moto lineal por los distintos caseríos del valle. Junto a eso, Máximo también se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas en los fundos ubicados alrededor del caserío. Sus padres son grandes agricultores y son respetados en los alrededores.
Debido a que los ingresos que obtiene no resultan suficientes para su manutención, ha decidido sembrar limón en un terreno que ha recibido como herencia de su padre, para que pueda comercializarlo después de la cosecha, para lo que solicita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles.
Máximo es una persona optimista y amable, cuyo anhelo es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Máximo is a 22-year-old man who has a partner but no children. He lives in a house with his parents. This is located in the San Pedrillo neighborhood, in the rural zone in the district of Tambogrande. He says that his house only has electrical service.
For work he transports people by motorcycle between the different neighborhoods in the valley. He also does agricultural work on the land around his house. His parents are great farmers and well respected in the area.
He says that the income that he earns is not sufficient for his support. He decided to grow lemons on land that he has inherited from his father.  He can sell the lemons after the harvest. This is why he is asking for this loan of 2,000 new soles.
Máximo is an optimistic and friendly person. His goal is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy goods and materials in order to grow and harvest lemons.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
All her life, Florentina has devoted her time to raising hogs and buying and selling of bananas.

Florentina is a loving and industrious mother of her six grown-up children. She has been both mother and father to her children. Despite her situation in life, she still stands firm and works hard to sustain their basic commodities needs. She thanks God for the guidance, protection, and unending love for her family. Shortage of income has pushed her to strive hard in running her livestock business. Currently, she is raising two pigs for fattening and one sow.  She needs to provide her hogs with proper nutrition and care in order to improve their growth until they reach their optimum growth. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for financial assistance, in the amount of P10,000 allowing her to buy feeds and vaccine for her hogs. She hopes to obtain this loan to attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is 57 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, Ramonita sells herbal medicine, herbal soap and any herbal alternatives. She has been in her business for seven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Ramonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to run her business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy more herbal products to sell. She plans on using the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Valle Fresco Group

texts.es: Doña Clementina es miembro del Grupo Solidario Valle Fresco, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los cuales son estudiantes, es una persona luchadora ya que le ha tocado salir sola adelante con sus hijos, es una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Desde hace 23 años doña Clementina inicio vendiendo comida en el mercado, pero en la actualidad tiene una mini pulpería y una pequeña fabrica de elaboración de coladores de café, ya que junto con dos de sus hijos atienden el negocio. No tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, ya que eso depende mucho de la demanda de sus clientes  y su principal clientela son sus vecinos. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar productos como ser: refrescos, churros, dulces, manteca, azúcar, arroz,  y telas para la elaboración de coladores de café. Con el apoyo de este préstamo su vida cambiara ya que podrá surtir más su negocio y así tendrá mejores ganancias. Cada día su gran desafío es poder sacar adelante su familia, su meta es superarse y poder ayudar a sus  hijos a culminar sus estudios. Doña Clementina es clienta de FAMA este es su primer ciclo y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Mrs. Clementina is a member of the group called, “The United Fresh Valley”. She is 55 years old, and a single mother of four children who are all students. She is a hardworking woman, as she wants to help her children progress. This is a hardworking and united family. For the past 23 years, Mrs. Clementina has been selling prepared food in the market. Actually, she has a small food stall and a small factory where she makes coffee filters. She does this business with the help of her two children. She doesn’t have fixed work hours. Her work hours are dependent upon the needs of her customers. Most of her customers are her neighbors. This loan that she is requesting she will use to buy the products that she needs, such as sodas, churros, sweets, butter, sugar, rice and fabric that she needs to make coffee filters. With the help of this loan her life will change. She will be able to provide a greater variety of goods for her business and have greater earnings. Every day, her greatest challenge is to help her family move ahead. Her goal is to achieve this goal and help her children finish their studies. Mrs. Clementina is a customer of FAMA. This is her first loan and she hopes to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy general supplies and fabric to make coffee filters.

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old. Ma. Flor is married and has 7 children. 

To make a living, Ma. Flor is running a retail store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Ma. Flor has been in her business for 2 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ma. Flor is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more items such as soap and canned goods. In 2011, Ma. Flor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soap and canned goods

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe es un hombre de 42 años de edad, conviviente y con 2 hijos a cargo suyo. Tiene domicilio propio ubicado en el Caserío Palominos, en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
Noe se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, a las cuales alimenta bien para que en el mejor momento de su desarrollo, puedan ser vendidas dentro del mercado local. Junto a eso, es también trabajador estable dentro de una parcela agrícola, en donde percibe un salario mensual.
Debido a la gran cantidad de alimento que necesitan sus aves, se hizo necesario solicitar un préstamo igual a 800 nuevos soles, dinero que se utilizaría para la compra de alimento para aves.
Noe es un trabajador incansable que trabaja esforzadamente por sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noe is a 42 year-old man with a live-in partner and two dependent children.

He has his own house (with electricity) located in the hamlet of Palominos, in the rural zone of Tambogrande district. Noe raises poultry, which he feeds well so that he can sell the birds at the local market at the prime moment in their development. Along with this, he also does steady work on a farm, where he receives a monthly salary. He needs to request a loan of 800 nuevos soles due to the large amount of feed his birds require. He will use the money to buy food for his birds.

Noe is an indefatigable worker who works as hard as he does for the sake of his children.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né vers 1961, Bakary vit avec ses 5 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec  d’autres parents, à Kolondièba ville. 
Infirmier d’Etat ayant pris sa retraite anticipée, Monsieur Bakary s’est vite convertie dans les activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  médicaments pour sa pharmacie qu’il a ouvert.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité.  
Bakary est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 cartons médicaments de première nécessité pour sa pharmacie à Kolondièba. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, dans sa pharmacie et  dans les villages en ambulant à une clientèle composée mixte. 
Bakary espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1961, Bakary lives with his five children and wife in a large traditional extended family with other relatives, in Kolondièba City. As a nurse having taken early retirement, Mr. Bakary soon switched to revenue-generating work, especially the buying and selling of medicines for the pharmacy he opened. He is much appreciated and in demand. 

Bakary is on his first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso that will be used to buy 5 boxes of basic medicines for his pharmacy in Kolondièba. Accepting cash, he makes his retail sales in his pharmacy and in the villages door to door. His customer base is mixed. 

Bakary hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to support his family, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada y con 1 hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijo, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Leoncio Prado, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla Pascuala es la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual tiene cultivos de mango y arroz, los cuales se venden luego de su cosecha y con el dinero ayuda con las obligaciones crediticias y con los gastos de la casa.
El monto del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado ovino y para sus aves de corral.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 49-year-old woman. She is married with one dependent child. She lives in her own house with her husband and child. This house is located in the Leoncio Prado neighborhood, in the Tambogrande district. She lives in the rural part of this district and it doesn’t have basic services.
Pascuala raises sheep and domestic birds. When they reach a certain weight and size she sells them in the local market. Her husband is a farmer with his own land where he grows mangos and rice. He sells the products he harvests and the money he uses to pay for his loans and the household expenses.
The loan that she is requesting, 1,000 new soles, she will use to buy balanced food for her sheep and domestic birds.

loans.use: to buy food for her sheep and birds

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona is a food vendor from Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. Simeona cooks viands that she sells to her community. She is able to help fulfill her family's daily needs through her food business.

Simeona is requesting a loan to buy food containers and ingredients such as meat and vegetables. She hopes to have a progressive business and successful children.

loans.use: to buy food containers and ingredients such as meat and vegetables

loans.name: Lizelda

texts.en:
Lizelda is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children ages 9 and 11. Lizelda's husband is also a farmer.

Lizelda primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lizelda works hard to keep their farm productive because her family relies on farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Lizelda hopes that through their business, her family will experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 34-year-old resident of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She provides for her 4 children's needs from the small amount of PHP 5,000 she earns monthly from their barber and vulcanizing shop business. This business is almost 10 years old and it serves as an aid to the income earned by her husband.

In 2008, Juliet joined GDMPC, and she applied for a microfinance loan from GDMPC for PHP 10,000 to buy more equipment and materials such as rubber. Juliet wants to expand her business someday.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and materials such as rubber.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre conviviente sin hijos a su cargo. Vive con su esposa en una comunidad campesina denominada la Estancia, la cual cuenta con 70 viviendas, con servicio de agua y luz, incluyendo iglesias y colegios.
Rafael se dedica a la venta de animales menores, tales como ovejas y chivos hace 10 años en el caserío donde reside, animales que llevan a la ciudad de Chiclayo para su posterior comercialización. Es un comerciante conocido y ya tiene clientes fijos.
El monto del crédito asciende a 2000 nuevos soles, cuya finalidad será para la compra de animales puesto que después de las lluvias en el lugar, ya hay pasto con el que puede alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Rafael is a man with a live-in partner and no dependent children. He lives with his partner in a rural community called La Estancia, which has 70 homes and is serviced with water and electricity, including churches and schools.

Rafael has been selling young animals, such as sheep and goats, from the hamlet where he lives for ten years. He brings the animals to the city of Chiclayo to sell. He is a well-known businessman with established customers.

The amount he is requesting is 2,000 nuevos soles, which he will use to purchase animals because after the rainy season there is sufficient pasture for him to feed them.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe    KOTOGNOGONTALA, vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 37 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de savons, de la petite restauration avec les friandises, la vente de céréales et d’habits. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Djeneba, qui est la femme assise, est la vendeuse de produits alimentaires (friandises) du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 kilos de farine de blé, 3 kilos de sucre, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 kilos de pomme de terre  auprès des revendeurs du marché de Kolondièba. La vente après la préparation des friandises se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame     Djeneba    espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The Kotognogontala group has four members, all married women. They live in polygamous families and average 37 years of age, with six children. They all live in the area of Kolondièbe and know each other as neighbors and relatives. They sell soap, cook food and sweets for sale, and also sell cereals and clothing. In the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are no on their first solidarity loan.

Djeneba, the one seated in the photo, is the group member who sells food (sweet dishes). She plans to sue her loan to buy two kilograms of wheat flower, three kilograms of sugar, five liters of vegetable oil and three kilograms of potatoes from vendors at the Kolondièba market. After preparing her sweet dishes, she sells them for cash and in credit to a customer base composed of both men and women. With this loan, Ms. Djeneba plans to achieve an average monthly income of 10,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for some household needs.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Janelyne

texts.en:
Janelyne is capable of doing extraordinary things for her family because she would like to have a better way of living. She is 32 years old, married and has been blessed with only one child.

Janelyne has been running her restaurant for more than five years. She is glad because despite the hardships in her business, she is still able to overcome them through the financial support given to her by lenders. She has paid back her previous loan and is asking for another loan in the amount of P10,000. This loan will be use to buy raw meat, vegetables, and other ingredients for her restaurant business. These funds are really of great benefit to her as a businesswoman because she will have the chance to improve the viands she serves to her customer. In this sense, she could attract more customers which will give her greater income, which will serve her family needs.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, vegetables, and other ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman living peacefully in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. She and her husband both work hard in order to be successful in life. The couple was blessed with three children. Two of her children had already finished their bachelor degrees and are currently working, while the youngest is still studying. 

Janet has owned and operated her bakery for more than three years. She aims to improve the quality of her homemade bread in order to encourage more customers to buy it and patronize her bakery. She is really thankful because she has a supportive husband in running the business. 

Janet would like that her youngest child could also finish her studies to be able to find better opportunities in life. So, to attain her goal, Janet would like to take out a loan amounting to P10,000 which will be use for buying flour, oils, sugar, and other ingredients of bread. She knows that through her loan, she could ensure that her bread is delicious and well-improved. In this way, she could obtain greater profit which will enable her to educate her youngest child and sustain the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, oils, sugar, and other ingredients for bread

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 52 years old, happily married and blessed with four grown-up children. 

The main source of income of Crestita’s family comes primarily from her retail store. She has been in this kind of business for almost ten years. The results of her labor make her really thankful to Almighty God who has given her the strength to face all the challenges in her life. 

Crestita would like to buy stock of groceries such as soft drinks, breads, assorted biscuits, ingredients, canned goods, shampoo, detergents, soap and other basic necessities. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of P10,000. She believes that through this loan, she could expand her business and make it more profitable which will enable her to provide customer satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries such as soft drinks, breads, assorted biscuits, ingredients, canned goods, shampoo, detergents, soap, and other basic necessities

loans.name: Inza

texts.fr:
Monsieur  INZA est âgé de 40 ans et père de 5 enfants. Il  vit dans une famille polygame au quartier Ouest de la ville de Kolondièba.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, il commença  très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son oncle qui menait plusieurs activités (courtier, vente d’articles divers, etc.). Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, INZA, lui opta pour l’achat vente d’essence et huile pour moteur. Il   mène cette activité depuis 4 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et de faire plus de bénéfice, il sollicite ce troisième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  700 litres d’essence. Il  s’approvisionne  en Côte d’Ivoire auprès des grossistes agrées et revend au comptant  à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt il   envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000FCFA.. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et de mener d’autres activités génératrices de revenus tels les activités de vente d’articles de quincailleries.
texts.en:
Mr. Inza is 40 years old and the father of five children. He lives in a polygamist family in Kolondieba’s western district.

He did not attend school for socio-economic reasons. He started very early on to be involved in income generating activities with his uncle who had several businesses (broker, sale of various items). After several years of apprenticeship Inza chose the purchase and sale of gasoline and motor oil. He has been practicing this activity for four years and enjoys a wide experience and a large customer base.

 With the objective of increasing his working capital and to make more profit, he is requesting a third loan, which will be used to buy 700 liters of gasoline. He gets his supply in Ivory Coast from authorized wholesalers and sells retail to a mixed clientele. 

With this loan he is planning on making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA. This profit will enable him to reimburse his loan and to conduct other income generating activities such as selling hardware items.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe   BENKADI   vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de savons, de la petite restauration avec les friandises, la vente de céréales (arachide, riz, mil) et d’habits. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Mariam,  qui est la femme assise, est la vendeuse de produits alimentaires du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 kilos de farine de blé, 10 kilos de sucre, 15 litres d’huile alimentaire, 10 kilos de patates douces, 5 kilos de pomme de terre  et de la farine de niébé auprès des revendeurs du marché de Kolondièba. La vente après la préparation des friandises se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame    Mariam   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI group, all married women, average 37 years of age and 5 children each.  They live in polygamous families, in the Kolondièba Cercle, and they know each other because they are neighbors or relatives, or have become relatives through marriage.  They buy and sell soap, snacks and confectionery, grains (groundnuts, rice, millet), and clothes.  They have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their business, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Mariam, who is sitting in the photo, is the group member who sells food products.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 kg of flour, 10 kg of sugar, 15 liters of cooking oil, 10 kg of sweet potatoes, 5 kg of potatoes and some cowpea flour.  She will purchase these supplies from resellers at the Kolondièba market.  Mariam prepares her snacks and then sells them for cash or on credit to a customer base made up of men and women.

With this loan, Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to buy the condiments that her family needs.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 30 years old and still single. Since she is single, she has made her own rule to help her parents in improving their way of living.

She started running her variety store in 2007. Since then, she has been joyously doing her daily routines in order to make a living. Christina is glad because her patience and sacrifices made her a better entrepreneur. By now, she would like to increase the volumes of her merchandise due to immediately sold out items and because she would like to minimize her expensive fare expenses in going to and from the market. In this situation, she needs more capital to buy merchandise. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P10,000. She hopes that this loan would be really helpful in achieving her goals in life to further provide for her family needs and make her business more productive.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Hero's Group

texts.en:
Hero is a young Iraqi wife. At the age of 28, she is a mother of three children and to contribute to the family's income she has been using her sewing skills for the past 5 years to work on her family's clothing needs and also on custom orders. 

From a small corner in her home, she makes dresses and other fabric household items, while also taking care of the children and her household. 

Hero took a small loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in order to purchase an over machine (overlock sewing machine) and some nice fabric and raw materials to be able to provide more choices and a better service to her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an over machine and some nice fabric and raw materials

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Composé majoritairement de veuves, d’une mariée et d’une célibataire, les 4 membres du groupe  KOTOTALA  vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants.
